lexUnit.name: grimace.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: contort one's face in an expressive way

sentence.text: The door connecting her office with Luke 's was closed , and Merrill grimaced .
He grimaced at the Ambassador 's daughter .
With her back still turned to him , she grimaced wryly at her own fancifulness .
Izzie grimaced at Gabriel from behind the playmaster 's back , and shook her head .
She went out and Nina grimaced at Joe .
At the rear of the shop his young assistant looked up from his work and grimaced at Lucy .
She uncurled herself , and got to her feet , grimacing slightly at the pain in her cramped muscles .
Back in bed she sipped morosely at the whisky , grimacing slightly at its taste , then giggling wryly at her own reaction .
Müller grimaced at the thought of her .
` Rachel and her parents might , " Maria retorted , and he grimaced in rueful acknowledgement .
Apparently not only had I collapsed on stage last night , but I was having intravenous chemotherapy between shows , sobbing and grimacing in agony in my dressing room .
Suddenly she lifted her hand and examined the brown , greasy deposit that her fingers had picked up and grimaced in disgust .
He launched himself out of the chair to rescue a rapidly cooling cup of coffee , grimacing slightly in disgust as he indicated the pot .
Grimacing in distaste , the Doctor lifted the man 's jacket aside to reach into the inside pocket , the flesh underneath giving way with the unnatural softness of rotting fruit .
He grimaced in exasperation .
The creature writhed and grimaced in the most horrible manner , malignance imprinted in its every contour .
So why was he rolling around like that , grimacing in pain ?
She grimaced to herself while thinking of how that fellow irritated her .
He grimaced slightly as a traditional Korean band in multi-coloured silk costumes played a welcome fanfare on conch shells .
Cool capable Kate the British Committee librarian confronts Kate the embryonic hysteric , catches her eye for a moment and grimaces with a bitter self-directed humour .
Zukov grimaced rudely behind the Tarvarian noncom 's back , and Rostov grinned .
Madeleine grimaced after she 'd shut the door on him .
She was still grimacing from the shock of it as Guido swept from the room , announcing over his shoulder , ` So , you 'd better deliver the goods -- or else I will ! "
The last step but one creaked protestingly and she grimaced apprehensively , her body almost turning to stone as she waited for Dane to suddenly appear and demand to know what she was doing .
Benjamin glanced sideways at me and grimaced despairingly .
She glowered at the television crew who were filming them , but realised they had no idea she was grimacing ferociously , so she returned to sipping champagne through the straw .
She stood and looked out of the window and saw the young woman waiting for Tom and grimaced ruefully .
Pringle grimaced sympathetically and nodding towards the riders , asked , ` What do you think of our local hunt ? "
Karen grimaced then looked at her wrist watch .
Winnie grimaced and bore it .
Ace grimaced , reached down and hesitantly pulled aside the tattered sheet of black silk .
The screaming would not stop , and he grimaced .
He looked at her indignantly and Maggie grimaced .
